intro: Dicranostyles villosa, commonly known as the hairy dicranostyle, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Dicranostyles villosa is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and unique morphological features.
